question.title: Unable to save data using hibernate in java

node.contents: I guess company_ID is primary key. You need to Auto Increment it

astNode.text: I guess company_ID is primary key. You need to Auto Increment it

node.contents: get back to your database and alter your column company_Id

astNode.text: get back to your database and alter your column company_Id

node.contents: Use @id and @GeneratedValue(strategy=AUTO) annotations on fields that map to primary key.

astNode.text: Use @id and @GeneratedValue(strategy=AUTO) annotations on fields that map to primary key.

node.contents: Either auto increment your id in table, or Use @id and @GeneratedValue(strategy=AUTO) annotations

astNode.text: Either auto increment your id in table, or Use @id and @GeneratedValue(strategy=AUTO) annotations

node.contents: Error message is very clear: `Field 'company_Id' doesn't have a default value`

astNode.text: Error message is very clear: `Field 'company_Id' doesn't have a default value`

node.contents: The error message states that you try to insert a new record into your table without filling a field which is required to be filled.

astNode.text: The error message states that you try to insert a new record into your table without filling a field which is required to be filled.

node.contents: In your case, that field seems to be your primary key or so called "id" which is normally auto-generated by incrementing it. So if you have 3 records, they have id 1, 2 and 3.

astNode.text: In your case, that field seems to be your primary key or so called "id" which is normally auto-generated by incrementing it. So if you have 3 records, they have id 1, 2 and 3.

node.contents: In Hibernate, you can do that by adding @GeneratedValue(strategy=GenerationType.AUTO) In MySQL, this automatically results in auto incrementing your id field. In other database servers, this can also result in having a seperate table for id's.

astNode.text: In Hibernate, you can do that by adding @GeneratedValue(strategy=GenerationType.AUTO) In MySQL, this automatically results in auto incrementing your id field. In other database servers, this can also result in having a seperate table for id's.

node.contents: For further information about GeneratedValue, just take a look into Hibernate documentation: http://docs.jboss.org/hibernate/stable/annotations/reference/en/html_single/#entity-mapping-identifier

astNode.text: For further information about GeneratedValue, just take a look into Hibernate documentation: http://docs.jboss.org/hibernate/stable/annotations/reference/en/html_single/#entity-mapping-identifier
